embeds.title: Watcher 3
embeds.description:
Act 3 Boss

** **Fleeting** Faith** - Watcher gains 1 Mantra :p_mantra: whenever you play a card. Watcher loses 5 Mantra :p_mantra: at the start of her turn. Watcher does not exit Divinity at the end of her turn.

**Cards**: Wish -> Live Forever, Good Instincts, Shame, Wave of the Hand, Swivel, Blind, Signature Move, Conjure Blade -> Expunger, Sanctity, Protect+, Empty Fist(+), Normality, Strike, Devotion

**Relics**: Velvet Choker, Torii, Captain's Wheel, Thread and Needle, Damaru (A19)

really wimpy boss. I feel more threatened by hermit 3 these days. Every character expect for gremlins is not significantly threated by her mantra gimmick and the gremlins just don't care if watcher is doing 70+ damage per turn. Most of the problems with this boss fight comes from the empty fist in her deck. On the turn with the empty fist, you can play as many cards as you want since she will end up only being in divinity stance for just that turn (and it only does 30 damage, which is pathetic by act 3 boss standards). Its like if time eater every 6 turns gave you a "cheat turn" where you got to play as many cards as you want

sometimes even watcher swinging at you for 120 isnt enough and you can just ignore here divinity all together since you have so much block, or sources of invincibly (through cards like shape of puddle, feel no pain and construction form)
finally watcher has lower HP then most of the other act 3  bosses because she gains less block then the others.

oh and because the second boss is set, even if you have a deck thats really weak to watcher theres not a high chance that she will even be the boss; unlike time eater who is in 2/3s of all run and you HAVE to respect to win consistently.
there is a 2/5 chance you guaranteed don't have to face her, and by the start of act 2 you already know if you have a 1/3 chance
Plus if you have a form of stun, you can make the blasphemy pull funni
And to be fair, most characters have some way of mitigating the big swing, things like [[Ignore Pain]] and [[Ghost Shield]] can just make it a non issue
that's watcher 2, this is mantra watcher from act 3

In several ways, this is just a much easier version of time eater. Most of watcher 3's damage is baked into entering divinity, and they lose 5 mantra at the end of every turn, so most decks get a lot of time to set up and play their powers/scaling without having to take significant damage. Unless you are card spamming hard (mostly just gremlins and snecko, sometimes stasis/acceleration heavy guardian), there is no significant threat that watcher will enter divinity until they have played devotion, and so you really aren't threatened until pretty late in the fight, and nearly every deck will have the scaling required to go over the top of this fight since it's at the end of act 3.

Then, once divinity is finally entered and the damage becomes threatening, you have the empty fist that you get to abuse. Now 42 damage is significant, but you have been given plenty of time to prepare for it, and many characters are capable of outputting more than that much block consistently, have access to blur effects, or have access to some form of intangible to dodge it. As it is, you basically get one free turn every 3-4 turns where the divinity gimmick doesn't matter at all and you can spam as freely as you want. It also eases the pressure a ton on the subsequent turn, where you can play 6-7 cards freely without retriggering divinity. 

I do really like that most of the downfall bosses have safety valves and counters built into their gimmicks, but in this case, you just have far too much control over watchers divinity, which means that it's almost never threatening. Maybe empty fist shouldn't be put into their rotation as often, or maybe they should be able to enter divinity faster. Setup time is also a problem here, you just get so much free time to deploy your scaling and powers, and that often trivializes the back half of the fight as well. Definitely could use a buff of some kind.

One more note on watcher 3 and it's implications for downfall. Card spam just isn't punished very heavily in downfall, both god of life and fleeting faith are much easier to deal with than time warp and beat of death. There's also a 2 in 5 chance that you see watcher before act 3, and only a 1 in 3 chance to fight them in act 3 if you haven't seen them yet, since the double boss is fixed as merchant. This is a drastic reduction from the 2 in 3 chance to fight time eater (and sometimes you can't be sure because the double boss is hidden, so you prepare for it anyways) from traditional. This may be part of why gremlins feel so incredibly strong (there are definitely other reasons, like temp hp and burst damage), and is something to keep in mind for strategies/relics that utilize card spam. It could also mean that looping/spamming planning and acceleration cards is an unpunished strategy for guardian.

messages.content: Time eater gains ~3.4 damage per turn per 12 cards, so ~.28 per turn per card. So one attack every 4 turns that gains 1 per card would actually be pretty in line.
especially if it replaces the strike that comes one turn after empty fist
though once she gets going it also gains 3 per turn on top of that
